intro: Hosta tokudama f. aureonebulosa, commonly known as the Aureonebulosa Hosta, is a cultivar of the Hosta plant native to Asia. It is characterized by its broad, waxy, and often variegated leaves that display a mix of green, white, and yellow hues. The plant typically grows to a height of 12 to 18 inches and produces small, fragrant flowers in late summer. It thrives in partial to full shade and prefers moist, well-draining soil. This variety is popular in gardens for its ornamental foliage and ability to add visual interest in shaded areas.
